description: Spiralling patterns cover this shadowy humanoid's skin, and its black hair trails away in wisps.

sections.body: Once per day as an immediate action, a wayang can choose to be affected by positive and negative energy effects as if it were an undead creature, taking damage from positive energy and healing damage from negative energy. This ability lasts for 1 minute.
sections.name: Light and Dark

sections.body: Originating from the Shadow Plane, wayangs are pixie-like in stature with extremely gangly limbs and skin the color of deep shadow. They follow a philosophy known as "The Dissolution," which teaches that in passing they again merge into shadow.
Wayangs are defined by class levels—they don't have racial Hit Dice. Wayangs have the following racial traits.
sections.name: Wayang

sections.body: Wayangs are nimble and cagey, but their worldview is strange.
sections.name: +2 Dexterity, +2 Intelligence, –2 Wisdom

sections.body: Wayangs are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a -1 penalty on combat maneuver checks and to CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.
sections.name: Small

sections.body: Wayangs have a base speed of 20 feet.
sections.name: Slow Speed

sections.body: Wayangs can see in the dark up to 60 feet.
sections.name: Darkvision

sections.body: Wayangs gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception and Stealth checks.
sections.name: Lurker

sections.body: Wayangs add +1 to the save DC of shadow subschool spells they cast. Wayangs with a Charisma score of 11 or higher gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/day—ghost sound, pass without trace, ventriloquism (caster level equals the wayang's level, saves are Charisma-based).
sections.name: Shadow Magic

sections.body: Wayangs get a +2 racial bonus on saves against spells of the shadow subschool.
sections.name: Shadow Resistance

sections.body: Wayangs begin play speaking Common and Wayang. Those with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following: any human language, Abyssal, Aklo, Draconic, Goblin, and Infernal.
sections.name: Languages
